title: Is time frame one word or two? - Quora

response.answer_text: Either. It depends on how you want the reader to think of it. “Timeframe” would indicate one item, whereas “time frame” indicates a larger, less distinct frame of time. One word example: The timeframe for the task completion is within the next two days. Two word example: The time frame for World War II is the 1940s. See the difference? It's very slight; you may just favor the 1-word version.
